page.title: 19Recreation
page.content: St. Edwards Hospital plays host to: Dances at New Year and through the year, film shows, entertainments by the local clubs and institutions. Films are also shown at the hospital and members of the village can attend. The Organisation of Music in Hospitals puts on shows which are appreciated. A Gala Day is held once a year in the hospital grounds to provide funds for extra amenities for patients. Ashcombe Cricket Club founded c.1860 is very active and their professionals include West Indian players Sir Frank Worall, Charles Ahmed and Sonny Rhamadin. The County Library visits the village. Deep Hayes Country Park has a picnic area and scenic walks. Arthur Coxon Activity Centre, Fridays.
